clinical_study.brief_title: Interfascial Pressure Into Ultrasound Guided Anterior Quadratus Lumborum Block Application
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of the Effect of Interfacial Pressure on Block Success During Anterior Quadratus Lumborum Block Application

lead_sponsor.agency: Bursa Yüksek İhtisas Education and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Bursa Yüksek İhtisas Education and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The Quadratus Lumborum block (QLB) is a recently described regional block. The block has been shown to be the result of abdominal analgesia as a result of administration between the quadratus lumborum (QL) muscle and the medial leaf in the thoracolumbar fascia. In this block, local anesthetic drugs are made between the quadratus lumborum (QL) muscle and the medial leaf in the thoracolumbar fascia. By this means, it has been reported to have provided a good analgesia since it relieved the somatic pain better in upper and lower abdominal surgeries.

detailed_description.textblock: QLB analgesic mechanism is include a lot of theory. in this study is research relationship between fascia pressure effect to relationship block success. We will use the ultrasound -guided anterior Quadratus Lumborum Block . Local anesthesic will be injected between quadratus lumborum muscle and psoas muscle with ultrasound. İn the Block procedure during will used the pressure line addition the block needle .

primary_outcome.description: in the Block procedure during will use the pressure line addition the block needle. And after the block procedure peripheral nerve block catheter will placement. İnterfascial pressure will be measured the postoperative 24. hours through catheter.

secondary_outcome.description: After the application, the sensory block level at the 30th minute will be determined by cold test.
Visual Analog Scale was used for pain.Pain intensity was measured using 0-10 cm visual analogue scale (VAS). (0=no pain, 10=intolerable pain)

intervention.description: İn the Block procedure during will used the pressure line addition the block needle .

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients who were in the American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) I-III class
• Underwent laparoscopic cholecystectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous history of preoperative opioid use,
- Allergy to local anesthetics,
- The presence of any systemic infection,
- Uncontrolled arterial hypertension,
- Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus
- Presence of infection in the block area,

overall_official.affiliation: University of Health Sciences, Bursa Yuksek Ihtisas Training and Research Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Bursa Yüksek İhtisas Education and Research Hospital
